title: Jaguar - works very well in IE
body:
# Excellent overall UX

## The comparison tool works well on IE11
While on mobile it exhibits issues that must be addressed, this tool behaves very well and very smoothly overall in IE11 and NVDA. User is able to add the three vehicles just by using the keyboard and the NVDA readout is correct and very similar to the VoiceOver experience on Chrome.

### Recommendations
From an IE compatibility perspective, no recommendations at this time. Please do however, improve the experience on mobile/tablet.

title: Jaguar - focus too small
body: # Focus ## Focus is too small In the three-column view the "build your own" button seems to get focus only where the icon is, and not the entire button as one would expect. ### Recommendations Please make the entire button focusable.

title: Jaguar - confusing focus on mobile
body: # Focus ## Merged focus of two radio-button items Whenever a user tries to choose an engine or a specification, the focus selects two components, instead of just the one, the user is therefore always unsure which item is actually selected. ### Recommendations Please emulate the same behaviour as in the "choose your vehicle" view.

title: Jaguar - headings on mobile
body: # Headings ## It's always the wrong heading advertised Whenever the user gets to a new slide in the app, the screen reader reads out the heading, but it's always a previous one or even from two steps before. This results in a very confusing experience. ### Recommendations This app seems to work on a slide by slide basis but with no routing so it's basically one big html view driven by javascript, which seems to confuse the screen reader related to what's actually in the view and what is not. Please consider rearchitecting the application in a way that will enable screen readers to see only what's in the view.

title: Jaguar - Focus trap on mobile
body: # Focus trap ## Unable to add second or third vehicle Once the user has added a vehicle, it slides go back to the first step. While "Choose your vehicle is in focus", the message on the screen reader actually states "add up to tree vehicles..." and the user is unable to go to any other component on the page. They're stuck. ### Recommendations This app seems to work on a slide by slide basis but with no routing so it's basically one big html view driven by javascript, which seems to confuse the screen reader related to what's actually in the view and what is not. Please consider rearchitecting the application in a way that will enable screen readers to see only what's in the view.

title: Jaguar - reflow issues
body:
# Reflow, keyboard

![Screenshot 2019-10-22 at 19 00 16](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6254855/67343589-a3af0300-f52d-11e9-9228-3352e9ff60e9.png)

## List of selected vehicles for comparison does not reflow
This is a problem for users because they are expected to horizontally scroll the view. This further complicates the life of visually impaired individuals.

### Recommendations
Consider creating a reflowable design, or add left and right buttons to enable horizontal scrolling via keyboard and focus.

title: Jaguar - heading levels
body:
# Headings

![Screenshot 2019-10-21 at 20 12 55](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6254855/67235543-302ec800-f43f-11e9-9abb-37722d111d4a.png)

## Heading levels should only increase by one
In the current setup there are three levels of headings 1, 2 and 4. This means heading level 3 was skipped.

### Recommendations
Consider turning the level 4 headings into level 3 (you can keep the styling as is).

title: Jaguar - can't go back to previous step
body:
# Keyboard

![Screenshot 2019-10-21 at 19 21 43](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6254855/67232125-8f3d0e80-f438-11e9-867f-2d22237d9655.png)

## Unable to go one step back in the process
When user opts for a car to be compared, and moves to the next section, there is no way to return to the previous step.

### Recommendations
It is highly recommended that users be able to either go back the previous step or advise the user that their action is going to be final and if they change their mind they'll have to refresh the page. Consider using some sort of routing or the [history API](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/History_API) as this would enable the browser's back button as well.

title: Jaguar - error modal focus trap
body:
# Focus trap

![Screenshot 2019-10-19 at 14 40 26](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6254855/67146234-0cbe1e80-f281-11e9-9a57-228af8ed1c4a.png)

## Unable to dismiss error modal
When selecting the third item in the list of cars, an error modal automatically pops up without auto-focusing on the OK button which would dismiss it. This results in a keyboard trap.

### Recommendations
Please auto-focus on the OK button as soon as it loads. 
Please add the capability to escape the modal via the 'esc' key.

title: Jaguar/Lrv - incomplete focus on nav item
body:
# Incomplete focus

![Screenshot 2019-10-19 at 14 28 45](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6254855/67145848-00d05d80-f27d-11e9-9207-b5456c65e212.png)
![Screenshot 2019-10-19 at 18 09 23](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6254855/67148808-a4c90180-f29b-11e9-9c06-65dc86560aad.png)
![Screenshot 2019-10-20 at 12 31 23](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6254855/67158861-94656500-f335-11e9-9be5-59b7fde1ac89.png)
![Screenshot 2019-10-20 at 19 24 02](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6254855/67164164-48371680-f36f-11e9-9c52-01e784aa78d6.png)

## Focus must be fully visible
While not strictly a requirement, having the entire focusable area shown is recommended.

### Recommendations
Please adjust the CSS so that the entire button's focus is visible.

title: Jaguar - all caps alt text
body:
# Text alternatives

![Screenshot 2019-10-19 at 13 39 35](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6254855/67145123-81d82680-f276-11e9-8b46-a1c3bd80e55c.png)

## Text alternative should not be all-caps
When text is hard-coded into the page in all-caps, some screen readers, depending on certain settings, could end up reading these as acronyms, making the message unintelligible for the user. This is especially important in alt text, as its purpose is to act as an alternative as it is. 

### Recommendations
Use no or regular capitalisation in alt text.

title: Jaguar USA - Custom cursor size cannot be adjusted.
body:
# Custom cursor

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/44382025/66766281-a6fb1c80-eea5-11e9-9388-4a29de0164da.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/44382025/66766294-af535780-eea5-11e9-9a73-c2799be6c341.png)

## Custom cursor cannot be adjusted

The colours, size and thickness of default cursors can be adjusted in Windows. This is important for low vision users who struggle to see the default cursor. 

The custom cursor implemented in the carousel section of the page is not size, colour or thickness adjustable which will cause problems for these users.

### Recommendation:

When implementing a custom cursor, ensure that it is adjustable.

title: Jaguar USA- Missing landmarks
body:
# Landmarks

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/44382025/66762459-ef164100-ee9d-11e9-8c45-4f00ae1a4569.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/44382025/66762386-cf7f1880-ee9d-11e9-9513-bf34832febec.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/44382025/66762421-defe6180-ee9d-11e9-8e20-93a6973c127f.png)

## Page missing landmarks

This page is missing the main landmark.

Both HTML5 and ARIA provide semantic mark-up to enable page sections to be marked in a meaningful way that aids web accessibility for screen reader users.

These allow users another way to navigate the page, identifying distinctive page sections such as headers, navigation, main content and footer.

### Recommendation:

Identify all the page landmarks. Include those that are missing such as main, secondary navigation and contact.

Add further semantic markers on pages using HTML5 or WAI-ARIA roles and give further context to ensure that the purpose of each individual section is conveyed to users. This will help assistive technologies to understand the page structure and where each landmark sections start and end.

title: Jaguar USA- meta-viewport
body:
# Resize text

Instances
meta[name="viewport"]
`<meta content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1, maximum-scale=1, minimum-scale=1, user-scalable=0" name="viewport">`

## Zooming and scaling must not be disabled.

The document must not use the user-scalable="no" parameter in the <meta name="viewport"> element because it disables text scaling and zooming which is essential to users with low vision.

### Recommendation:

Ensure that no content is lost when zooming in by implementing a responsive design.

title: Jaguar - all page content must be contained by landmarks
body:
# Landmarks

## All page content must be contained by landmarks
Currently the app is contained by a ```div``` with no ```aria-role``` assigned to it. Users therefore cannot navigate by landmark.

### Recommendations
Consider wrapping the entire app in ```<main>``` rather than ```<div>``` or adding ```role="main"``` to the ```<div>```. Alternatively, place your main navigation inside a ```nav```.
